005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.DynamicContext;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.INodeItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.impl.DefaultExpectConstraint;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
012
013import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
014
015/**
016 * Represents a rule requiring a Metaschema assembly, field, or flag data
017 * instance to pass a Metapath-based test.
018 * <p>
019 * A custom message can be used to indicate what a test failure signifies.
020 */
021public interface IExpectConstraint extends IConstraint {
022  /**
023   * Get the test to use to validate selected nodes.
024   *
025   * @return the test metapath expression to use
026   */
027  @NonNull
028  String getTest();
029
030  /**
031   * A message to emit when the constraint is violated. Allows embedded Metapath
032   * expressions using the syntax {@code \{ metapath \}}.
033   *
034   * @return the message if defined or {@code null} otherwise
035   */
036  String getMessage();
037
038  /**
039   * Generate a violation message using the provide item and dynamic context for
040   * inline Metapath value insertion.
041   *
042   * @param item
043   *          the target Metapath item to use as the focus for Metapath evaluation
044   * @param context
045   *          the dynamic context for Metapath evaluation
046   * @return the message
047   */
048  String generateMessage(@NonNull INodeItem item, @NonNull DynamicContext context);
049
050  @Override
051  default <T, R> R accept(IConstraintVisitor<T, R> visitor, T state) {
052    return visitor.visitExpectConstraint(this, state);
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Create a new constraint builder.
057   *
058   * @return the builder
059   */
060  @NonNull
061  static Builder builder() {
062    return new Builder();
063  }
064
065  final class Builder
066      extends AbstractConstraintBuilder<Builder, IExpectConstraint> {
067    private String test;
068    private String message;
069
070    private Builder() {
071      // disable construction
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Use the provided test to validate selected nodes.
076     *
077     * @param test
078     *          the test metapath expression to use
079     * @return this builder
080     */
081    @NonNull
082    public Builder test(@NonNull String test) {
083      this.test = test;
084      return this;
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * A message to emit when the constraint is violated. Allows embedded Metapath
089     * expressions using the syntax {@code \{ metapath \}}.
090     *
091     * @param message
092     *          the message if defined or {@code null} otherwise
093     * @return this builder
094     */
095    @NonNull
096    public Builder message(@NonNull String message) {
097      this.message = message;
098      return this;
099    }
100
101    @Override
102    protected Builder getThis() {
103      return this;
104    }
105
106    @Override
107    protected void validate() {
108      super.validate();
109
110      ObjectUtils.requireNonNull(getTest());
111    }
112
113    private String getTest() {
114      return test;
115    }
116
117    private String getMessage() {
118      return message;
119    }
120
121    @Override
122    protected IExpectConstraint newInstance() {
123      return new DefaultExpectConstraint(
124          getId(),
125          getFormalName(),
126          getDescription(),
127          ObjectUtils.notNull(getSource()),
128          getLevel(),
129          getTarget(),
130          getProperties(),
131          ObjectUtils.requireNonNull(getTest()),
132          getMessage(),
133          getRemarks());
134    }
135  }
136}
